eventName: The Black Forest Wills A Dream
storyInfo: Typhon teaches Magallan the wisdom of the hunter, and the laws of Sami's Eternal Hunt. They encounter a rockhorn that has been gravely wounded by a demon, and the accompanying shaman apprentice ends its suffering, but it can no longer nourish nature.

attributes.content: Hiss—
Huff—
Hiss—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You can take off the breather, Magallan. There are no spores here.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Oh, okay.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Whew... hah...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I've never been so scared of mushrooms in my life.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I warned you, Maggy: Don't touch anything, don't touch anything, and don't touch anything.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Now you know why.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: M-My—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The empty box you gave me? I put the mushrooms inside and sealed it. Here.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Th-Thanks.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: *pant*—*pant*—
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I didn't expect the spore density to be so high, or that it could paralyze the respiratory system.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's a carnivorous mushroom. Where do you think its food comes from?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: So how come you aren't affected at all?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: We hunters have ways to deal with them.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: If I died in one of those mushroom swamps, I'd never live it down.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Sami) Typhon, the sacrifice.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Sami) Sacrifice... are we there?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Takes a deep breath)
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You're right.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Where are you going? Wait for me!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: And what do you by 'sacrifice'? Me?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Of course not, you birdbrain.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: This is the heart of Sami, the First Forest.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Where we come from, and where we go.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Prepare some food as tribute to Sami, and we can enter.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Would bad things happen if we don't?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Who knows? Do you want to find out?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Er, never mind.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Is hardtack okay?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No idea.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Crush it and spread it on the ground.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: A-Alright.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Sami) Great land, we ask your leave to pass over you.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Sami) We offer you this sacrifice, that you may watch over us, and protect us from bloodshed, from being hunted.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Sami) Sami says it's okay, ladies.
(Sami) It will eat well thanks to your generosity.
Isn't that a little... casual? Young shaman.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: ...Apprentice shaman.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: This isn't really a formal occasion, after all. Sami wouldn't mind the presence of a child of the Santalla Tree.
A shaman, a hunter, and an outlander? That's a rare sight.
I don't suppose you're here just for the experience?
We're in a hurry to head south, and don't have time to go around the First Land.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: I see. My teacher often takes this shortcut too.
Not this time, though. He left me here alone to 'experience the Samivilinn.'
I've been here for days, wandering the woods without a sliver of revelation to be found.
You should know what I mean, child of the tree.
Please, call me Santalla.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Very well, Santalla. Can you tell me what our teachers expect us to bring back from here?
I do not know, oak-child. I have only been here to witness. This is not where my trial was.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is that so? What a shame.
We have a long road ahead of us. Let's hurry.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hmm...
Wait!
I'll come with you.
I know the trees with the best shade, the cleanest streams, and the safest animal trails.
I can be your guide!
There's no one more qualified!
Let me come with you, Santalla. I'm so bored here I could turn into a tree.
What do you think, great shaman?
And what about you, hunter? Or our outlander friend?
I guess I don't mind...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: We're all agreed, then?
Let's go, then! Welcome to the First Forest!
Hmph...
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: One more question, oak-child.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Hm? What is it?
What should we call you?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Me? Hm...
My Sami name might be a little hard to remember... My teacher calls me Oakcup, so you can too.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: May I ask how you got that name?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Because he always grabs my horn and tries to drink from it when he's drunk.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hey, are we being watched?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Like, by a deity...?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Big predators. One on the tree, one behind Simone in the bushes, and one behind that tree to the left.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, is that all?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: After all the weird stuff we've encountered, dealing with carnivorous wildlife seems almost quaint.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Should I be ready for a fight then?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No need. They're not hungry enough to risk attacking.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: So stop worrying about their dinner and start worrying about ours—!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Huh? Look out!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Need help?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: No thanks, I'm done.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A tuskbeast lies prone on the ground, glaring at Typhon.
A gaping wound stretches from its cheek all the way to its foreleg.
I guess one of them was hungry enough. Terrible choice of prey, though.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Go. Your meat tastes terrible anyway.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The tuskbeast does not seem willing to leave. It crouches down in the shadows, ready to attack again.
Bang!
A loud bang rings out in the air before it, sending it scampering into the distance and leaving behind only a scattered trail of blood.
Did you just shoot something with your finger, Typhon?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah, for scaring away big guys like these.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A roll of leaves?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You wrap up air with leaves until it forms a ball.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Takes notes)
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: But how do you wrap air with leaves?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Don't ask. I've tried to teach others, but no one's ever been able to learn it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Easy, it's just an unlucky hornbeast that got its neck bitten in half. Maybe by the one that attacked us, maybe by another.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Looks like our outlander friend has grown accustomed to the ways of this land.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: A few more weeks of this, and she'll be a fully-fledged Sami.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Ahaha...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: An outlander who understands Sami. How nice.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I remember working as a guide for some Columbian tourists while on a pilgrimage.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: They started screaming when they saw some carnivores doing their carnivoring. Apparently, they thought it was too bloody and uncivilized.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Not that I'd call myself civilized, but didn't they pay good money to come here and see the 'untamed wilderness'?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: One of them even tried to stop the beasts, and nearly ended up as their next meal.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Their clothes were dignified enough, but certainly not the people wearing them.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: You have quite a mastery of Columbian.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Ursine) Not just Columbian! I just can't keep my mouth shut. Guess I'm a natural-born chatterbox.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: And I suppose my teacher was a weird old man for teaching me all that.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Broken Sami) Know.. a bit... ah, yes, true.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The folks back home hate it when I just strike up a conversation with southerners. One time, there was a regular Ursus caravan that passed through the tribal market, and...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (When was the last time I returned?)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (The breath of the wild continues to echo through this place...)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Does Amma still watch over this forest?)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (Something isn't right.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (The influence of Amma lingers... but it's not alone.)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: (The Black Mark of Ursus...)
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: What is it, Simone?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Nothing.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Has our guide found somewhere we can spend the night?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Yup, inside that tree up ahead.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Cup says it's hollow, with enough room for the four of us.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I've never seen a hollow tree before.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Then now's your chance.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Wow, we could easily fit another person or two in here!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's the largest tree house around. Could hold close to a dozen.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Where's Typhon?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The hunter? She went looking for musbeast fruit stashes. She wanted something extra for dinner.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: You should rest. I'll set up some protection.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Is that really necessary? The tree's already been blessed, and there are even talismans hanging off of it.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: She's so serious.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: That's how Simone is. I'd have frozen to death three, maybe four times by now if she weren't here to help.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Simone? Hm... Simone... Santalla... I think I've heard that name.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Is she someone famous in Sami?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Oh... No, not at all. I must be remembering wrong.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I have a hard time keeping track of anything I haven't seen for myself on my pilgrimage.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: So maybe I'm mixing her up with someone else.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Opens notebook)
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You seem to know a lot, Cup. Mind if I ask a few questions?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Shoot.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I picked up two pieces of bark from a tree. And they had symbols on them.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I want to know what they mean.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's a code that Sami uses to communicate with us.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: They could be messages about the past, the future, or about nature.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The same symbols can also mean very different things, depending on who is receiving them and when.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: May I have a look?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I have them right here.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: This is... the old tree's bark...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: 'Snowpriest'... 'Delight'...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Looks like a message from a clan tree to its shaman. You can have them back.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What's the difference between a 'Snowpriest' and 'shaman'?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Think of a Snowpriest as the head shaman or a greater shaman. He may not be the oldest, but he's certainly the highest in status, the most powerful, and the local leader.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Incidentally, my teacher is a Snowpriest.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Will... you become one too?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Nah, it's such a pain taking care of the tribe and solving all their problems. Leave that to someone who wants the job.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: So... are you a shaman now?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Nope, just an apprentice. I have no idea what Sami wants, or even what it wants from me.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Which is why my teacher made me come here to feel the Samivilinn.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: And have you felt it?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Nope.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Leaves fall, rivers flow. It's all the same. I don't feel anything unusual.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I have plenty of complaints for him the next time I see him.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: You're back, Simone!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Let me have a look.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Wow. You can really do that with ground frost?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: By the way, I heard that the one who serves the old tree can control the wind and snow, making them dance at her fingertips.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The old tree takes no servants, nor does it need one like me.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Well, if you don't want to talk, I'm not going to press the matter.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Old tree... Is there a difference between the clan trees?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: There's only one tree that can be called old in Sami.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: It represents the Past, and often appears with the heralds of the Present and the Future.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The three are separate but one, transcending Sami.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The Past...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: By your outfit, I thought you were an explorer.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I am.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You seem more like—
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: What's the word?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: A folklorist?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: As an explorer, it's always good to learn more about an unfamiliar place.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'll bring you some Sami books if we ever meet again, explorer.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: That'd be great!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: On the other hand, there's only so much I can carry in extreme environments... Maybe the equivalent of two volumes of the 'Encyclopedia Columbiana.'
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's about this long, this wide, and this thick... hardcover.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Yeah, not sure why you thought that'd help me at all. Just give me your luggage and let me feel the weight.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh, it's all bundled up to be carried on my back. One second.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: There.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: It's all on the ground.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hm. Good, looks like you can fit it.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: That's about the same weight as two Sami books.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Er... what sort of books?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Legends, tribal history, that sort of thing.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: But a full tribal history takes up enough wooden tablets to fill an entire tree house, so I'll spare you that.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I-I thought the paper books I saw in the Cyclops's cave were Sami books...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Maggy!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, welcome back.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Do you have any more of those flare sticks?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Yeah, why?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I tried one when I was picking the fruits, and it worked even better than the leaf ball.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: You mean you ran into a tuskbeast?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Why wouldn't I? I was walking alone in the forest and they're hungry.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Anyway, do you have any?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Half a bundle. How many do you need?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Give me two for now.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: And here, fruit from a musbeast stash. I've washed them with water.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Thanks!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Let's eat together and get to bed early. I don't want to wake up and find the door blocked by a bunch of hungry beasts.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'll take the night watch.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: You already stayed up the other night. It should be my turn.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: It's safer here, and I won't be up all night. Consider it a chance for me to relax.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Alright... if you say so.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Whisper) Be careful. There are demons in the forest.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Let's make a campfire, Simone.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Absolutely not!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Do you want to draw the attention of every predator in the forest?!
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: A-A lamp, then?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Not much difference between a lamp and a fire, light-wise.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: If you can't sleep, then try this.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: A dreamcatcher. Helps you pass the night in peace, with no dreams of becoming prey.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: I'll be going to bed, then.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Good night.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: As Oakcup promised, Magallan was not troubled by nightmares that night.
Instead, she dreamed another dream.
In it, she is still in the forest at night.
But she is not alone.
She is a creature like Emperor.
Beside her, a massive white hornbeast slumbers in the dream of another.
It was serene and beautiful. Magallan could not help but reach out to caress It.
But It is so dignified and solemn that her hand stops in mid-air.
She decides to lay down next to It and dream together with It.
A dream within a dream.
In it, a dark shadow shambles towards the tree hole where the group is sleeping.
Behind it is a trail of darkness and filth.
Black snow falls from the sky, burning away Santalla's frost and creating a gap.
The shadow walks towards the gap, leaving its vile trail on the ground.
Suddenly, a hornbeast catches its attention.
The hornbeast leaps and disappears. By the time the shadow turns around, the gap is filled with frost again.
It gazes upon the frost, and shambles towards where the hornbeast disappeared.
The hornbeast is still by Magallan when she wakes up.
But Its horn had begun to melt.
Then Its body, then the forest.
Magallan sits upon the snow, snowflakes falling on her beak.
For some reason, she feels regret.
She never sees the hornbeast's eyes, until the dream vanishes.
Oh!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: You're up early today.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I just happened to wake up...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Perhaps that was not the entire story. Her sleeping bag is wet near the pocket.
She remembers pulling the pocket's zipper shut before sleeping, but it is open now, as if something fell out.
There was nothing missing though—
Except a little Sami souvenir.
Typhon...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: What's the matter? Got out the wrong side of bed?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Does Amma's Affection disappear?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Mother has to take care of so many. She can't stay by your side forever.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Did the Affection I gave you melt?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Maybe that's a good thing.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Maybe she took care of a big problem for us, without us even realizing.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: If possible, I'd have liked to keep it with me.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Well, we can always find another. It's not that hard.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Oh, okay!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: That's... the beast that attacked us the other day.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hasn't been dead for long.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Looks like it was rammed to death by a large herbivore.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Self-defense, to avoid being eaten?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No, it came for revenge while the predator was weakened.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Maybe it lost a friend or family when it was little, and sought vengeance once it grew up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Animals, seeking revenge...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The hunter kills its prey, and the offspring takes revenge. Humans do that, and so do animals.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: We're not as different from them as you 'civilized' folk believe.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: But that aside... hunter, shaman, over here. We have a bigger problem.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Simone... this rockhorn...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Yes, a demon did this.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Take the foal away, oak-child. Don't let it lick the mother's blood.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Gotcha.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Imitates a rockhorn cry)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The foal hears the call and staggers away from its mother and towards Oakcup.
(Sobbing cry)
attributes.name: Baby Rockhorn

attributes.content: It's scared. Don't worry, I'm here.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Licks the baby rockhorn's forehead)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Picks up her camera)
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Click—
Magallan looks at the photo.
With her own eyes, she can clearly see the rockhorn bleeding blood as black as ink.
But the blood doesn't appear in the photo at all.
It wasn't caused directly by a demon, just a corrupted creature, some kind of beast.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: It won't be turned.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Can you save it, oak-child?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: One second. Watch over the baby for a bit, Magallan.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Imitates a rockhorn cry)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oakcup leads the foal to Magallan, then heads towards the injured rockhorn.
H-Hello?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Magallan stretches out her hand, and the foal happily rubs its head against her palm.
Hehe...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: (Low cry)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Pained cry)
attributes.name: Rockhorn

attributes.content: Not good... We might've had a chance if we'd arrived earlier, but now...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: All we can do is ease its pain.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Stand aside, hunter.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Don't let the foal see.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: (Long call)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Stifled moan)
attributes.name: Rockhorn

attributes.content: No need to be afraid. It won't hurt.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Waves staff)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Sleep now. Roam free in dream.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Over hills, over swamp♪
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Puts down staff and takes out dagger)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Rest in Amma's woods, for she watches over you♪
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: No more pain, no more suffering♪
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: With the souls of all life—
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Pierces the rockhorn's throat with the dagger)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Roam free on Sami's back♪
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Rest now, soul of the land...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oo... (imitates rockhorn mother's cry)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hearing the call, the foal hurries to Oakcup's side.
(Low cry)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (High-pitched call)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Fear not. Your mother is with you.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: With her blood... her tears...
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Draws the bloodied dagger across the mother rockhorn's eye)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Her horn.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Criss-crosses with the dagger)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Stopping at your...?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The foal lightly kicks Oakcup's knee with its hoof.
(Hoof.)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Draws a mark on the hoof with the dagger)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Go, friend. Your life has just begun.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The foal continues to circle Oakcup, seemingly seeing him as its new family.
Well... I suppose that works.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Only until we take care of your mother, though.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: The foal does not answer, only rubbing itself against Oakcup.
What's the plan?
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: This is more than an apprentice can handle.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: (Sharp whistle)
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Screw training. I'll let my teacher take care of it.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: That way will take you out of the forest towards a nearby marshfolk village. They'll give you a warm welcome.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I'll stay here with the kid and stop the rockhorn's bleeding until my teacher arrives. I can't let it become food for scavengers.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Say hello to the Canopy Sage for me.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Oh, so you knew—
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Tell him that this is connected to the Black Mark of Ursus.
attributes.name: Santalla

attributes.content: Black Mark of Ursus? Alright, I'll pass it on.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Nothing good ever comes of Ursus being involved.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Do you have enough rations?
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: I'm not about to become the first apprentice shaman to starve to death in the forest.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Here, take this.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: A flashlight?
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: I can see well enough in the dark, but it might be useful to the old man. Thanks.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Farewell, friends.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: May Sami keep you safe.
attributes.name: Oakcup

attributes.content: Finally, out of the woods!
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Hey, I think I'm getting a signal.
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: The marshfolk trade with you guys a lot, so they've got some of your metal things set up.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What will Cup do with the rockhorn's carcass?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Cleanse the corrupted soil and blood, clean the wound, then leave it.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Shouldn't it be buried?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: No point. Scavengers would just dig it out.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Is it the same with people?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: More or less.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Like Oakcup said, here in Sami there's not much difference between humans and beasts.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Hunt and be hunted. Eat and be eaten.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: The best we can do is show our prey a bit of kindness and make sure they're dead before we eat them.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: That's the law of nature, the will of the north, the Samivilinn.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: If you want to change that, there's only one way.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: What's that?
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: Become Sami itself. Become the All-Father.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Of course, that's just a legend. No one's ever seen it happen, haha.
attributes.name: Typhon

attributes.content: Stop messing with me...
attributes.name: Magallan

attributes.content: 'Checking status of Black Mark. Liebafowl is about to trade with those upon water.'
Another carcass, another victim.
The hunter steps over the hunted, with no intention to feed.
This was not to satiate hunger, nor for revenge, but pure and simple killing.
It is a hornbeast, a corrupted one, with an empty hole on its abdomen, but it is still 'alive.'
Its blood, tears, and saliva are all black as ink.
The hunter roams the animal trail, looking for a new victim.
There is a figure swaying at the same frequency, not far away.
It is clearly human.
Its unique and rhythmic breathing can be heard clearly, even without approaching.
Hiss... huff...
